title: 104_s1868
content: The "Deepwater Port Modernization Act" amends the Deepwater Port Act of 1974 to include transportation, storage, and other uses consistent with the Act's purposes. It also allows for the transportation of oil from the Outer Continental Shelf of the United States. Section 4 of the Deepwater Port Act of 1974 is amended to revise subsections (a), (c), and (e) regarding the terms of licenses for deepwater ports. Amendments include removing certain paragraphs, redesignating others, and specifying conditions set by the Secretary. The Deepwater Port Act of 1974 is amended to prioritize license conditions over regulations, allowing operating procedures to be specified in an operations manual approved by the Secretary of the department where the Coast Guard operates. The Deepwater Port Act of 1974 is amended to prioritize license conditions over regulations, allowing amendments to be made to a license or operations manual without being considered a rulemaking or adjudication. The Deepwater Port Act of 1974 is amended to allow the Secretary to determine appropriate procedures for issues, amend, transfer, or reinstate licenses, prioritizing license conditions over regulations. The Deepwater Port Act of 1974 is amended to allow the Secretary to exempt a person from certain information requirements if deemed unnecessary for determinations under the Act. SEC. 5 of the Deepwater Port Act of 1974 is amended to address antitrust review by removing certain subsections and clarifying the authority to challenge anti-competitive situations. SEC. 6 deals with common carrier status. SEC. 6 of the Deepwater Port Act of 1974 addresses common carrier status, ensuring that licensees accept and transport oil without discrimination. SEC. 7 of the Deepwater Port Act of 1974 amends Section 10(a) to specify procedures for deepwater ports, including unloading regulations and compliance with approved operations manuals. Compliance with the operations manual approved by the Secretary of the department in which the Coast Guard operates fulfills all Act requirements related to the manual's subjects.
